result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ken Peralta

records.addlTxt: Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant Ken Peralta in court.  Attorney Timothy Mistrioty in court for Ken Peralta.  Prosecuting attorney Samuel Thomas Berg in court for the State of Wisconsin. Not guilty plea entered by counsel and trial reserved. Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for December 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's Invocation of Right to Counsel

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Defendant' Authorization to Appear and Act

Adjustment Number: 22A 329368,
Payable Number: 269653,
Receipt Number: 22R 020367,
Amount: $20.00

Defendant Ken Peralta in court.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. Prior bond to cover existing file. Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court. Needs 3 weeks to obtain funds for an attorney. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.

BOND TO COVER 22CM533 & 22CM418

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH M.O. dob 3-9-1986 or RESIDENCE or THEIR CHILDREN. If defendant and victim(s) are living together, defendant may go to their residence once with a police officer to retrieve the defendant's personal belongings. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
Signed bond filed with the court.

ADDRESS INFO for Ken Peralta
Current: 123 E Dundee Rd, Wheeling, IL 60090 United States  (Effective: 08-09-2022)
Prior: 140 W. School St #203, Sharon, WI 53585
